intro: Brachystelma praelongum subsp. thunbergii, commonly known as the Thunberg's ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white during the cooler months. Its leaves are typically reduced to scales, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
